segment.source: About Application Licensing
segment.target: About Application Licensing

segment.source: About Application Licensing
segment.target: About Application Licensing

segment.source: About Application Licensing
segment.target: About Application Licensing

segment.source: You can manage application licenses directly from the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.
segment.target: You can manage application licenses directly from the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.

segment.source: License Types
segment.target: License Types

segment.source: The System Center Application Virtualization System currently supports the following license types:
segment.target: The System Center Application Virtualization System currently supports the following license types:

segment.source: Unlimited License—Allows access to the application by any number of simultaneous users.
segment.target: Unlimited License—Allows access to the application by any number of simultaneous users.

segment.source: This method of licensing is appropriate when you want to associate an enterprise-wide license with an application.
segment.target: This method of licensing is appropriate when you want to associate an enterprise-wide license with an application.

segment.source: Concurrent License—Enables you to define the maximum number of concurrent users who are allowed to use the application.
segment.target: Concurrent License—Enables you to define the maximum number of concurrent users who are allowed to use the application.

segment.source: Named License—Enables you to assign a license to an individual user.
segment.target: Named License—Enables you to assign a license to an individual user.

segment.source: A named license can be used to ensure that a particular user will always be able to run the application.
segment.target: A named license can be used to ensure that a particular user will always be able to run the application.

segment.source: You can combine concurrent and named licenses for the same application.
segment.target: You can combine concurrent and named licenses for the same application.

segment.source: Licensing is disabled by default, but you can enable it from the Provider Pipeline tab of the Provider Properties dialog.
segment.target: Licensing is disabled by default, but you can enable it from the Provider Pipeline tab of the Provider Properties dialog.

segment.source: For details about enabling and disabling licensing, see How to Set Up or Disable Application Licensing.
segment.target: For details about enabling and disabling licensing, see How to Set Up or Disable Application Licensing.

segment.source: Provider Policies
segment.target: Provider Policies

segment.source: Provider policies were developed for the Application Service Provider (ASP) model.
segment.target: Provider policies were developed for the Application Service Provider (ASP) model.

segment.source: In this model, a single ASP can host a single Application Virtualization System for multiple clients, where each client needs to remain isolated.
segment.target: In this model, a single ASP can host a single Application Virtualization System for multiple clients, where each client needs to remain isolated.

segment.source: Clients might have dramatically different requirements—for example, one client might require authentication while another does not.
segment.target: Clients might have dramatically different requirements—for example, one client might require authentication while another does not.

segment.source: You can use provider policies to associate permissions with clients so that only the approved users can access each virtual application or virtual application package.
segment.target: You can use provider policies to associate permissions with clients so that only the approved users can access each virtual application or virtual application package.

segment.source: For the enterprise customer, you can use this feature when you have strict licensing requirements for one or more applications.
segment.target: For the enterprise customer, you can use this feature when you have strict licensing requirements for one or more applications.

segment.source: Under this situation, the licensing component is disabled on the Provider Pipeline tab of the Provider Properties dialog.
segment.target: Under this situation, the licensing component is disabled on the Provider Pipeline tab of the Provider Properties dialog.

segment.source: The Provider Pipeline tab also has check boxes to enable authentication, authorization (Enforce Access Permission Settings), and metering (Log Usage Information).
segment.target: The Provider Pipeline tab also has check boxes to enable authentication, authorization (Enforce Access Permission Settings), and metering (Log Usage Information).

segment.source: If your configuration has special requirements, you can write your own pipeline components and add them to the system by clicking the Advanced button.
segment.target: If your configuration has special requirements, you can write your own pipeline components and add them to the system by clicking the Advanced button.

segment.source: Account Authorities
segment.target: Account Authorities

segment.source: The account authority is the domain in which the Application Virtualization Server is installed.
segment.target: The account authority is the domain in which the Application Virtualization Server is installed.

segment.source: As you proceed through the server installation, you are prompted to supply a domain name; the domain in which the computer is installed is detected and used by default.
segment.target: As you proceed through the server installation, you are prompted to supply a domain name; the domain in which the computer is installed is detected and used by default.

segment.source: When users attempt to log in to the system, they are prompted for their credentials before they can access that domain.
segment.target: When users attempt to log in to the system, they are prompted for their credentials before they can access that domain.

segment.source: The Application Virtualization System supports multiple domains.
segment.target: The Application Virtualization System supports multiple domains.

segment.source: You can grant application access to user groups in other domains if a trust relationship is established between domains.
segment.target: You can grant application access to user groups in other domains if a trust relationship is established between domains.

segment.source: Users must supply credentials that are recognized by each domain.
segment.target: Users must supply credentials that are recognized by each domain.

segment.source: In the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, you can change the primary domain (account authority) and the credentials that are used to access it.
segment.target: In the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, you can change the primary domain (account authority) and the credentials that are used to access it.

segment.source: Authentication
segment.target: Authentication

segment.source: Authentication is the mechanism used to confirm a user's identity.
segment.target: Authentication is the mechanism used to confirm a user's identity.

segment.source: Any user with a recognized user name and password has access.
segment.target: Any user with a recognized user name and password has access.

segment.source: In the Application Virtualization System, you can enable or disable authentication through a check box on the Provider Pipeline tab.
segment.target: In the Application Virtualization System, you can enable or disable authentication through a check box on the Provider Pipeline tab.

segment.source: By default, Windows Authentication is enabled.
segment.target: By default, Windows Authentication is enabled.

segment.source: Authorization
segment.target: Authorization

segment.source: Authorization is the process used to confirm a user’s identity.
segment.target: Authorization is the process used to confirm a user’s identity.

segment.source: After confirming the user's identity, the system determines whether the user was granted access to the system and to which applications the user was granted access.
segment.target: After confirming the user's identity, the system determines whether the user was granted access to the system and to which applications the user was granted access.

segment.source: The Application Virtualization Server Management Console has an Enforce Access Permission Settings check box on the Provider Pipeline tab to enable or disable authorization.
segment.target: The Application Virtualization Server Management Console has an Enforce Access Permission Settings check box on the Provider Pipeline tab to enable or disable authorization.

segment.source: In the Application Virtualization System, access is granted to a user group only, not to individual users.
segment.target: In the Application Virtualization System, access is granted to a user group only, not to individual users.
